title: Bananas Foster
description: A classic New Orleans dessert featuring caramelized bananas flambéed with rum and banana liqueur, served warm over vanilla ice cream. This dramatic tableside dessert combines sweet, buttery flavors with a spectacular flame presentation.
source_attribution: From Cooking Up a Storm: Recipes Lost and Found from The Times-Picayune of New Orleans by Marcelle Bienvenu and Judy Walker, via Epicurious

instructions.instruction_text: Slice 2 bananas in half lengthwise and brush with 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice. Melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter with ¼ cup dark brown sugar in a flat chafing dish or 10-inch skillet. Add the bananas and sauté until just tender. Sprinkle with ⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon.

Remove from the heat and add 2 tablespoons banana liqueur and ¼ cup white rum. Carefully ignite with a long match. Use a large long-handled spoon to baste the bananas with the warm liquid until the flame burns out.
Divide 1 pint vanilla ice cream among four dishes. Top each one with a banana half and some of the sauce. Serve immediately.

title: Joe's Beef Bourguignon
description: A classic French braised beef dish slow-cooked in red Burgundy wine with bacon, mushrooms, and aromatic vegetables. This rich and hearty stew develops deep, complex flavors through a traditional long braising process. Perfect for special occasions or cozy winter dinners.

ingredients.ingredient_name: well-trimmed boneless beef chuck, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes
(750ml) of red Burgundy wine (or Pinot Noir)
chopped fresh thyme or 2 tablespoons dried thyme
salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Sauté 8 ounces of coarsely chopped bacon in a large Dutch oven over high heat until brown and crisp, about 8 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towels to drain.

Season 3 pounds of beef chuck cubes generously with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Toss with 1/3 cup all-purpose flour to coat evenly. Working in batches, brown the beef in the same pot over high heat, about 5 minutes per batch. Transfer browned meat to a large bowl.

Add 2 julienned large yellow onions and 3/4 pound of carrots cut into 1-inch pieces to the pot. Sauté until light brown, about 6 minutes. Add 12 whole peeled garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute. Transfer vegetables to the bowl with the beef.
Add 1 cup of beef broth and 1/2 cup Cognac or brandy to the pot. Bring to a boil and scrape up browned bits from the bottom. Reduce the liquid until it forms a glaze, about 8 minutes.

Return the beef, vegetables, and their juices to the pot. Stir in the remaining 2 cups beef broth, 2 bottles (750ml) red Burgundy wine, 1/3 cup fresh thyme (or 2 tablespoons dried), 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon tomato paste. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cover the pot with a lid and transfer to the oven. Cook until the beef is tender, about 1 hour 20 minutes.

About 30 minutes before the beef finishes cooking, melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 1/4 pounds quartered mushrooms and sauté until golden brown, about 6-8 minutes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside.
When the beef is tender, ladle the liquid from the pot into a large saucepan. Spoon off any fat. Bring the liquid to a boil and reduce until thickened to about 2 3/4 cups, about 40 minutes.

Add the sautéed mushrooms to the reduced sauce. Pour the sauce back into the pot with the beef and vegetables. Stir to combine. (The dish can be made ahead at this point. Cool, cover, and refrigerate. Reheat over low heat before serving.)
Ladle the beef and vegetables onto plates or into bowls. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley and serve with crusty bread, potatoes, buttered egg noodles, or polenta.

title: Beef Bourguignon
description: A classic French braised beef dish cooked slowly in red Burgundy wine with bacon, vegetables, and herbs. This rich and flavorful stew is perfect for special occasions and cold weather dining.

ingredients.ingredient_name: well-trimmed boneless beef chuck, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes (from 7-bone chuck roast)
chopped fresh thyme or 2 tablespoons dried

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 325°F. Sauté 8 ounces coarsely chopped bacon in heavy large Dutch oven over high heat until brown and crisp, about 8 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer bacon to paper towels. Season 3 pounds beef cubes generously with salt and pepper; coat with 1/3 cup all purpose flour, using all of flour. Working in 3 batches, brown beef in same pot over high heat, about 5 minutes per batch. Transfer meat to large bowl. Add 1 1/4 pounds peeled boiling onions and 3/4 pound carrots cut into 1-inch pieces to same pot and sauté until light brown, about 6 minutes. Add 12 whole peeled garlic cloves and sauté 1 minute. Transfer vegetables to bowl with beef.

Add 1 cup beef broth and 1/2 cup Cognac or brandy to pot; boil until reduced to glaze, scraping up browned bits, about 8 minutes. Return meat and vegetables and their juices to pot. Add 2 bottles red Burgundy wine, 1 1/4 pounds mushrooms, 1/3 cup chopped fresh thyme (or 2 tablespoons dried), 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar, 1 tablespoon tomato paste and remaining 2 cups beef broth. Bring to boil, stirring occasionally. Cover pot and place in oven. Cook until beef is tender, about 1 hour 20 minutes.

Ladle liquid from stew into large saucepan. Spoon off fat. Boil liquid until reduced to 2 3/4 cups, about 40 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Pour liquid back over beef and vegetables. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.) Rewarm over low heat before serving.

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: A rich and creamy Russian-inspired dish featuring tender beef strips sautéed with mushrooms and shallots in a luxurious cognac cream sauce. Served over buttered egg noodles and finished with fresh dill and paprika for an elegant comfort food experience.

ingredients.ingredient_name: beef tenderloin or boneless ribeye, well trimmed, cut into 2x1x1/2 inch strips
(1 cup plus 2 tablespoons) crème fraîche or whipping cream

instructions.instruction_text: Pat 2 1/2 pounds beef strips dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat 3 tablespoons vegetable oil in a heavy large skillet over high heat until very hot. Working in batches, add meat in a single layer and cook just until brown, about 1 minute per side. Transfer meat to a rimmed baking sheet.

Melt 3 tablespoons butter in the same skillet over medium-high heat. Add 6 tablespoons finely chopped shallots and sauté until tender, about 2 minutes. Add 1 1/2 pounds thickly sliced mushrooms, sprinkle with pepper, and sauté until liquid evaporates, about 12 minutes.
Add 1 1/2 cups beef broth and 3 tablespoons cognac to the mushroom mixture. Simmer until liquid thickens and coats mushrooms, about 14 minutes.

Add the seared meat and any accumulated juices to the pan along with 1 1/8 cups crème fraîche and 1 1/2 tablespoons Dijon mustard. Simmer over medium-low heat until meat is heated through but still medium-rare, about 2 minutes. Stir in 1 1/2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill and season sauce with salt and pepper.

Meanwhile, cook 18 ounces wide egg noodles in boiling salted water until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Add remaining 6 tablespoons butter and toss to coat. Season noodles with salt and pepper.
Divide noodles among plates, top with beef and sauce, and sprinkle generously with 1 1/2 tablespoons paprika.

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: A classic Russian dish featuring tender beef tenderloin strips in a rich, creamy mushroom sauce with cognac and crème fraîche. This elegant comfort food is served over buttered egg noodles and topped with paprika.

ingredients.ingredient_name: piece beef tenderloin, well trimmed, meat cut into 2x1x1/2 inch strips

instructions.instruction_text: Pat 1 2 1/2-pound piece of beef tenderloin (cut into 2x1x1/2 inch strips) dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in heavy large skillet over high heat until very hot. Working in batches, add meat in single layer and cook just until brown on outside, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to rimmed baking sheet.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in same skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1/4 cup finely chopped shallots and sauté until tender, scraping up browned bits, about 2 minutes. Add 1 pound thickly sliced button mushrooms. Sprinkle with pepper and sauté until liquid evaporates, about 12 minutes. Add 1 cup beef broth, then 2 tablespoons Cognac. Simmer until liquid thickens and just coats mushrooms, about 14 minutes. Stir in 3/4 cup crème fraîche and 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard. Add meat and any accumulated juices from baking sheet. Simmer over medium-low heat until meat is heated through but still medium-rare, about 2 minutes. Stir in 1 tablespoon chopped dill. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Meanwhile, cook 12 ounces wide egg noodles in large pot of boiling salted water until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain. Transfer to bowl. Add remaining 4 tablespoons butter and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Divide noodles among plates. Top with beef and sauce. Sprinkle generously with 1 tablespoon paprika.

title: Joe's Spiced Brisket
description: A richly spiced, slow-braised brisket featuring warm garam masala and aromatic herbs. The meat is seared to perfection then braised in red wine, Coca-Cola, and beef stock with vegetables for 5-6 hours until fork-tender. This unique combination creates a deeply flavorful and tender roast perfect for special occasions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: amount kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper
beef stock, or more if needed

instructions.instruction_text: Rub the 5.5-pound brisket generously with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Let sit for 30 minutes at room temperature.
Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C).

Heat a large Dutch oven over high heat. Add 3 tablespoons olive oil and let it heat up. Sear the brisket on both sides until golden brown (about 8 minutes per side). If the brisket is too large, sear it in sections. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil.

Lower the heat to medium. Add 1 large thinly sliced onion, 4 large chopped carrots, and 4 large chopped celery stalks to the Dutch oven, scraping up browned bits. Cook for 6-8 minutes until caramelized.

Add 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar and 2.5 cups red wine. Stir well, scraping the pan's bottom to deglaze. Reduce the liquid by one-third. Stir in 1 heaping tablespoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon paprika, and 1 teaspoon dried thyme, mixing evenly with the vegetables.
Place the seared brisket back into the Dutch oven, nestling it among the vegetables.
Pour in 1 can of Coca-Cola and enough beef stock (about 4 cups) to nearly submerge the brisket.
Cover tightly with foil and a lid. Transfer to the oven and braise for 5-6 hours or until the brisket is fork-tender.
Let the brisket rest for 15-20 minutes before slicing against the grain. Serve with the braising liquid and vegetables.

title: Buttery Breakfast Casserole
description: A rich and indulgent breakfast casserole featuring flaky croissants soaked in a creamy custard with Italian sausage, scallions, and Gruyère cheese. Perfect for feeding a crowd or special weekend mornings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: croissants (about 5 to 7), split in half lengthwise
extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for baking dish
scallions (6 to 7), white and light green parts thinly sliced, greens reserved
¾ pound sweet Italian sausage, casings removed

instructions.instruction_text: Heat oven to 500 degrees. Spread 1 pound of split croissants on a large baking sheet and toast, cut side up, until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes (watch carefully to see that they do not burn). Let cool, then tear into large bite-size pieces.

In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, warm 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the sliced white and light green parts of 1 bunch of scallions and ¾ pound of sweet Italian sausage meat (casings removed); cook, breaking up meat with a fork, until mixture is well browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in 2 teaspoons of finely chopped fresh sage, and remove from heat.

In a large bowl, toss together the torn croissants and sausage mixture. In a separate bowl, whisk together 8 large eggs, 3 cups whole milk, 1 cup heavy cream, 1½ cups of the grated Gruyère cheese, 1¼ teaspoons kosher salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper.

Lightly oil a 9- x 13-inch baking dish. Turn croissant mixture into pan, spreading it out evenly over the bottom. Pour the egg custard mixture into pan, pressing croissants down gently to help absorb the liquid. Cover pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.

When ready to bake, heat oven to 350 degrees. Scatter the remaining ½ cup of grated Gruyère cheese over the top of the casserole. Transfer to oven and bake until casserole is golden brown and firm to the touch, 45 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes. Garnish with the reserved sliced scallion greens before serving.

title: Caramelized Onion Tart with Figs & Blue Cheese
description: An elegant hors d'oeuvres featuring sweet caramelized onions, dried figs, and tangy blue cheese baked on flaky puff pastry. Perfect for entertaining or special occasions.

instructions.instruction_text: Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium-low heat.
Cut the ends off 2 pounds yellow onions and slice in half, end to end. Slice each half thinly to approximately 1/8 inch thick.

Add the sliced onions to the melted butter and continue to cook over medium-low to low heat. Heating too high will brown or burn the onions without caramelizing. Slowly cook the onions, stirring occasionally until they begin to soften and brown.
Continue to cook until the onions are evenly light brown and just begin to stick on the skillet, 15-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and add 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper. Cool and chill until ready to assemble, or cool to room temperature and assemble.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Thaw 1 package puff pastry (2 sheets) overnight in the refrigerator. Working with one sheet at a time, roll out on a floured surface to 11 x 13 inches. Place pastry on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
With a sharp knife, make a line around the perimeter of the pastry 1/2 inch in from the edge, making sure not to cut through the pastry.
Stir together 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard and 3 tablespoons fig preserves. Brush half of the mixture on one sheet of pastry.
Sprinkle half of the prepared caramelized onions over the pastry followed by half of the 6 ounces sliced figs.
Finish by crumbling half of the 6 ounces blue cheese evenly over the top.
Repeat steps 8-10 with the second sheet of puff pastry and remaining toppings.
Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the pastry is puffed, 20 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool 5 minutes. Slice into pieces and serve.

title: Chicken Florentine
description: Perfectly browned chicken breasts are smothered in a creamy spinach sauce that comes together with ease, all in one skillet. The highlight is the buttery white-wine sauce enriched and thickened with cream cheese. This weeknight recipe delivers restaurant-quality flavors in just 30 minutes.
source_attribution: New York Times Cooking, recipe by Dan Pelosi

ingredients.ingredient_name: ¼ cup grated Parmesan, plus more for serving
dried basil (or 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil)
dried oregano (or 1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano)

instructions.instruction_text: On a plate, mix together ¼ cup all-purpose flour, ¼ cup grated Parmesan and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Dredge each of the 4 chicken breasts in the mixture, evenly coating on both sides.

Heat a large pan over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan and melt to combine. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown (but not cooked through), about 4 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from pan and set aside.

Add remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan and let it melt. Add 1 minced medium shallot, 2 minced garlic cloves and a pinch of salt and cook, stirring until the shallot is softened and the garlic is aromatic, about 2 minutes.

Add ½ cup dry white wine, ½ cup chicken broth, 1 teaspoon dried basil and 1 teaspoon dried oregano, and stir, scraping the browned bits from the bottom of the pan, until the liquid has reduced by about half, 3 to 4 minutes. Add ½ cup heavy cream and 2 ounces cream cheese and stir, allowing the cream cheese to soften and melt, until a thick sauce forms, about 6 minutes. Add 2 cups packed baby spinach and stir until it is folded into the cream sauce and the spinach is beginning to wilt, about 1 minute.
Return the chicken breasts to the pan and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and serve immediately with freshly grated Parmesan on top.

title: Chicken Piccata: Pan-Fried Breaded Chicken Cutlets with Lemon & Caper Sauce
description: Chicken Piccata is simply divine and easy to make at home! Features juicy, fried chicken cutlets in a syrupy lemon and butter sauce, garnished with briny capers and flat-leaf parsley. The sauce includes caramelized lemon slices and a touch of cream for richness.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ½ cup parmesan cheese, freshly grated
½ cups breadcrumbs (best to use a combination of panko and regular)
, cut into very thin slices with seeds removed
capers or large Sicilian caper berries, stemmed

instructions.instruction_text: Carefully slice 4 chicken breasts in half horizontally. Place each half in a ziplock bag and gently pound with a mallet or back of heavy pan until the breast is an even thickness all around. Repeat until you have 8 same-size chicken cutlets.
Place 1 cup flour in a wide plate or shallow bowl.
Whisk 3 eggs, 3 tablespoons milk, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon black pepper together in a wide bowl until blended.
Mix 1½ cups breadcrumbs and ½ cup parmesan cheese in a wide plate or shallow bowl.
Dredge the cutlets in flour to coat both sides. Then dip in the egg mixture, and finally in the breadcrumbs.

Heat ½ cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry the cutlets two at a time until golden brown on both sides. Place the cooked cutlets on a baking sheet lined with paper towels until all the cutlets are done.

Remove the pan from the heat and pour off the oil. Add 3 tablespoons of the butter and return the pan to medium heat. When the butter is melted, place the lemon slices over the bottom of the pan. Cook until the lemon slices are golden, about 3 minutes. Scoop the lemon slices out and set them aside.

Add the remaining 3 tablespoons butter, ½ cup white wine, and the lemon juice and bring to a boil. Boil until the liquid is syrupy, 3-4 minutes. Pour in 1½ cups chicken stock, bring to a boil and cook until reduced by about half, about 5 minutes.

Add 2 tablespoons capers, 3 tablespoons cream, and half of the 2 tablespoons parsley. Place the fried cutlets in the sauce and simmer a few more minutes until the cutlets are warmed. Do not let the cutlets be covered entirely in the sauce or they will lose their crispiness.
To serve, place one cutlet on a plate, ladle some sauce over the top and garnish with cooked lemon slices and remaining parsley.

title: Italian Baked Eggs
description: Delicious marinara cheesy baked eggs that can be made in just 10 minutes for a complete breakfast. A simple yet flavorful dish perfect for a quick morning meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly oil two 10-ounce ramekins or coat with nonstick spray.
Divide 1 cup marinara sauce evenly into the ramekins. Top with 4 large eggs, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup shredded gruyere cheese and 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Place into oven and bake until egg whites are cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve immediately, garnished with 1/4 cup chiffonade basil leaves, if desired.

title: Corned Beef and Cabbage
description: A satisfying braised corned beef dish with tender vegetables that's perfect for St. Patrick's Day or any day. The beef is slow-cooked until tender, then finished with a honey-mustard glaze and served with potatoes, carrots, and cabbage that have absorbed the flavorful cooking juices.
source_attribution: New York Times Cooking, Sarah DiGregorio

ingredients.ingredient_name: ¼ cups semi-dry white wine, such as Riesling
red or Yukon gold potatoes, cut into 1- to 2-inch pieces
3 large carrots (about ½ pound), peeled and cut into 1- to 2-inch pieces
½ small head green or savoy cabbage (about 1 pound), core left intact, cut into 4 wedges
Dijon mustard, plus more for serving

instructions.instruction_text: Heat the oven to 325 degrees. Remove the 3 to 3½-pound corned beef from its packaging in the sink and reserve the spice packet. Rinse the beef well under cold running water and pat it dry with paper towels. If there is a substantial fat cap on top of the beef, place it on a cutting board and trim most of it, leaving at least a thin layer of fat on top, about ⅛- to ¼-inch thick, to keep the meat moist.
Transfer the corned beef to a large Dutch oven with the fat cap facing up. Add the 1¼ cups white wine and the spices from the packet. Cover the pot and transfer to the oven to cook for 3 hours.

Baste the beef with the cooking liquid. Drop the 1 pound of cut potatoes and ½ pound of cut carrots into the liquid surrounding the beef and lay the 4 cabbage wedges on top. Cover and cook until the corned beef and vegetables are tender, 1 to 1½ hours. A paring knife should slip easily into the beef, but the meat should not be falling apart.

Heat the broiler to high. Stir together 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard and 2 tablespoons honey in a small bowl. Remove the corned beef from the pot and put it on a foil-lined sheet pan. Spoon the honey-mustard glaze all over the top and sides of the beef and slide it under the broiler. Cook until the glaze bubbles and caramelizes in spots, about 3 minutes.

Let the corned beef rest for 5 to 10 minutes, then slice it against the grain into ½-inch slabs. Place the beef slices on the serving platter alongside the vegetables and drizzle everything with a little bit of the cooking liquid. Taste the vegetables, and season them with flaky sea salt if necessary. Season the beef and vegetables to taste with black pepper. Serve with additional Dijon mustard.

title: Curried Cauliflower And Chicken
description: A flavorful one-pan curry dish featuring tender chicken cubes and cauliflower florets in a spiced tomato-based sauce. This aromatic dish combines traditional curry spices with fresh vegetables for a satisfying and healthy meal.
source_attribution: Mark Bittman, New York Times Cooking

ingredients.ingredient_name: neutral oil, like canola or grape seed
boneless chicken, cut into ½-inch cubes
cilantro or parsley for garnish, optional

instructions.instruction_text: Put 2 tablespoons neutral oil in a 12-inch skillet, and turn the heat to high. Add ½ cup minced onion, and cook, stirring occasionally, until it begins to brown. While it's cooking, trim 1 head cauliflower (about 2 pounds) and cut the florets into ½-inch-thick pieces.

When the onion has browned a little, add 1 tablespoon cumin seed and 2 teaspoons curry powder and cook about 30 seconds. Add the cauliflower, and stir, still over high heat, for another minute. Cut up 5 or 6 canned plum tomatoes, and add them to the pan along with their juice, ¼ cup water and a generous sprinkling of salt and pepper. Cover, and turn the heat to medium-low.

Cook 10 minutes, stirring once or twice. Add 1 pound boneless chicken (cut into ½-inch cubes), stir, cover the pan again and cook 6 to 8 minutes longer, or until the chicken is cooked through. (If the sauce appears to be drying up at any time, add a little more water.) Stir in the juice of 1 lemon, taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with minced cilantro or parsley if you like, and serve.

title: Curry Chicken with Lamb Fergi
description: A hearty curry dish featuring tender chicken breast stewed in aromatic spices and vegetables, with lamb cubes added at the end for optimal texture. The rich sauce is enhanced with cream and served over rice for a satisfying meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: neutral oil (like canola or grape seed)
cauliflower, about 2 pounds, cut into ½-inch-thick florets
6 canned plum tomatoes, with juice, roughly chopped
¼ cup water (or more if needed)
and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

instructions.instruction_text: Prepare all your vegetables: cut 1 head cauliflower (about 2 pounds) into ½-inch-thick florets, thinly slice 1 carrot and slice 1 small red bell pepper, and mince ½ cup onion. Season 1 whole chicken breast with salt and pepper.

Heat 2 tablespoons neutral oil in a large 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the ½ cup minced onion, sliced carrot, and sliced bell pepper to the skillet. Sauté for about 4-5 minutes, until they begin to soften and the onion is lightly browned.

Add 1 tablespoon cumin seeds, 2 teaspoons curry powder, ½ teaspoon garlic powder (if using), ½ teaspoon turmeric (if using), and ½ teaspoon Ras el Hanout (if using). Stir the spices into the vegetables and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the cauliflower florets to the skillet. Stir everything together so the cauliflower is well-coated with the spices. Sauté the cauliflower with the vegetables and spices for about 2 minutes.

Add the 5-6 chopped canned plum tomatoes with their juice and ¼ cup water to the skillet. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Pour in ½ cup heavy cream and stir thoroughly. Place the seasoned whole chicken breast into the skillet, nestling it into the sauce and vegetables. Spoon some sauce over the chicken breast.
Cover the skillet and reduce heat to medium-low. Let simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken breast is cooked through and the cauliflower is tender.
Once the chicken breast is cooked, carefully remove it from the skillet and set aside to rest. Keep warm until serving.
Just before serving, turn heat to medium and add ½ pound lamb stew cubes to the skillet. Stir them into the hot curry sauce and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until just cooked through.
Stir in the juice of 1 lemon and adjust seasoning if needed. Slice the chicken breast and serve alongside the curry over cooked rice. Garnish with minced cilantro if desired.

title: Cook's Illustrated Aged Eggnog
description: A smooth, mellow eggnog that's aged for three weeks to develop better flavor and eliminate any food safety concerns from raw eggs. The alcohol sterilizes the mixture during aging, and dairy is added just before serving to create the perfect balance.

instructions.instruction_text: In a large bowl, whisk together 12 large eggs until well combined.
Add 1 1/2 cups bourbon, 1/2 cup cognac, and 1/3 cup dark rum to the eggs and whisk until smooth.
Add 1 1/2 cups sugar and whisk until completely dissolved.
Transfer the mixture to an airtight container and refrigerate for at least 3 weeks to allow aging and sterilization.
After 3 weeks, pour the aged base through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any egg solids.
Stir in 6 cups whole milk and 1/2 cup heavy cream until well combined.
Serve immediately, or chill until ready to serve. Stir before serving as separation may occur.

title: Diane Locandro's Oven Braised Beef with Tomatoes and Garlic
description: A tender and flavorful braised beef chuck roast slowly cooked with tomatoes, garlic, and herbs. This comforting dish develops rich, deep flavors through long, slow braising in the oven.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless beef chuck roast, tied with string
garlic, separated into cloves and unpeeled

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 300°F.
Season the 3.5 pound beef chuck roast generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
Place the seasoned roast in a Dutch oven.
Using scissors, cut the 28 oz can of whole tomatoes into rough chunks and pour over the beef along with the juices.
Add 1 head of garlic cloves (separated but unpeeled) around the roast.
Pour 1/2 cup red wine and 1/2 cup beef broth into the pot.
Scatter 2 tablespoons fresh thyme over the top and season generously with additional salt and pepper.
Cover the Dutch oven and braise in the preheated oven for 4 hours, until the beef is fork-tender.
Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Fergi's Eggplant Parmesan and Ravioli Bake
description: A hearty Italian-inspired casserole that layers roasted eggplant with sautéed shiitake mushrooms, wilted spinach, and tomato burrata ravioli in a rich tomato-caper sauce. This comfort food dish combines the classic flavors of eggplant parmesan with the heartiness of stuffed pasta for a satisfying family meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: eggplants, trimmed and sliced lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick slices
shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and caps sliced
toasted, chopped walnuts or pine nuts

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Brush both sides of 2 large eggplants (sliced lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick slices) generously with 1/2 cup olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the eggplant slices in a single layer on baking sheets. Roast for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and tender. Set aside.
While the eggplant roasts, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 medium finely chopped yellow onion and cook until soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in 2 minced garlic cloves and 1 teaspoon dried oregano and cook for one minute until fragrant.
Pour in 2 (28-ounce) cans crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper, and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook for at least 20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Stir in 2-3 tablespoons rinsed capers during the last 10 minutes of simmering.

While the sauce simmers, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a separate skillet over medium-high heat. Add 10 ounces sliced shiitake caps and cook, stirring occasionally, until they have released their liquid and are well-browned, about 8-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.

In the same skillet, heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add 10 ounces fresh spinach (in batches, if needed) and toss until just wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat, squeeze out any excess liquid, and season lightly with salt. Set aside.
Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs with 1/4 cup of toasted, chopped walnuts or pine nuts.
Spread a thin layer of tomato-caper sauce on the bottom of the dish. Arrange a single layer of roasted eggplant slices (using about half the slices).
Top with another layer of sauce, followed by a layer of all the sautéed mushrooms, and then all the wilted spinach. Distribute half of the 8 ounces mozzarella slices over the spinach.
Arrange the raw 8.8-ounce package of Tomato & Burrata ravioli in a single, even layer. Spread a layer of sauce over the ravioli, ensuring they are mostly covered.
Arrange the remaining eggplant slices on top. Top with the remaining sauce, the remaining mozzarella slices, and all of the 1/2 cup Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
Sprinkle the nutty breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top. Drizzle lightly with a bit of olive oil.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the topping is golden brown and crisp.
Let the casserole rest for at least 15 minutes before slicing and serving. Garnish with fresh basil and enjoy.

title: Fergi's Eggplant Parmesan (with Mushrooms, Mozzarella, and Capers)
description: A lighter, no-fry version of eggplant parmesan based on Jamie Oliver's method. This dish layers roasted eggplant with a zesty tomato-caper sauce, earthy mushrooms, and melted mozzarella for a richer, more complex final dish.
source_attribution: Based on Jamie Oliver's lighter, no-fry method

ingredients.ingredient_name: eggplants, trimmed and sliced lengthwise into ¼-inch thick slices
½ cup extra virgin olive oil (for eggplant)
½ cup fresh breadcrumbs or panko

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Brush both sides of 2 large eggplants (sliced lengthwise into ¼-inch thick slices) generously with about ½ cup olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange the eggplant slices in a single layer on baking sheets. Roast for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden brown and tender. Set aside.
While the eggplant roasts, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add 1 medium finely chopped yellow onion and cook until soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in 2 minced garlic cloves and 1 teaspoon dried oregano and cook for one minute until fragrant.
Pour in 2 (28-ounce) cans crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper, and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook for at least 20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Stir in 2-3 tablespoons rinsed and dried capers during the last 10 minutes of simmering.

While the sauce simmers, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a separate skillet over medium-high heat. Add 10 ounces sliced cremini mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they have released their liquid and are well-browned, about 8-10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). Spread a thin layer of tomato-caper sauce on the bottom of the dish.
Arrange a single layer of roasted eggplant slices. Top with another layer of sauce, followed by a layer of the sautéed mushrooms.
Distribute half of the 8 ounces fresh mozzarella slices over the mushrooms, then sprinkle with half of the ½ cup Parmigiano-Reggiano.

Repeat the layers: eggplant, sauce, mushrooms, remaining mozzarella, and remaining Parmesan. Finish with a final layer of sauce, any remaining Parmigiano-Reggiano, and an even layer of ½ cup fresh breadcrumbs. Drizzle lightly with a bit of olive oil.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the topping is golden brown and crisp.
Let the casserole rest for at least 15 minutes before slicing and serving. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and enjoy.

title: Five Modern Mother Sauces Collection
description: A collection of five versatile modern sauces that can elevate any dish: yogurt sauce, pepper sauce, herb sauce, tahini sauce, and pesto. These lighter, brighter condiments are the contemporary answer to classical French mother sauces.
source_attribution: The New York Times, by Samin Nosrat, August 2, 2016

ingredients.ingredient_name: vary by specific sauce chosen from the five types mentioned

instructions.instruction_text: Choose one of the five modern mother sauce types: Basic Yogurt Sauce, Basic Tahini Sauce, Basic Pepper Salsa, Basic Herb Salsa, or Basic Pesto Sauce.
Follow the specific recipe for your chosen sauce type (recipes referenced but not included in this article).
Use the completed sauce to elevate roasted vegetables, grilled meats, fish, beans, or rice by adding vibrant flavor, texture and color.

title: Gjelina's Roasted Yams
description: These roasted yams are caramelized until deeply golden and served with a tangy lime yogurt sauce. The combination of honey, Espelette pepper, and fresh lime creates a perfect balance of sweet, spicy, and creamy flavors.
source_attribution: Sam Sifton, adapted from Gjelina: Cooking From Venice, California

ingredients.ingredient_name: Espelette pepper, or crushed red-pepper flakes
salt and freshly ground black pepper
, both green and white parts, trimmed and thinly sliced, for garnish

instructions.instruction_text: Heat oven to 425°F. Cut 3 large yams lengthwise into 4 wedges per yam. Put them in a large bowl, and toss them with 2 tablespoons honey, ½ tablespoon of the Espelette pepper or crushed red-pepper flakes, and 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Let it sit for 10 minutes or so, tossing once or twice to coat, as the oven heats.

Transfer the yams to a foil-lined, rimmed baking sheet, season with salt and pepper and then bake until they are deeply caramelized around the edges and soft when pierced with a fork at their thickest part, approximately 30 to 35 minutes.

As the yams roast, combine ½ cup Greek-style yogurt, 4 tablespoons fresh lime juice, and remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a small bowl, and whisk to combine, then season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.

When the yams are done, transfer them to a serving platter, drizzle the yogurt mixture over them and garnish with the remaining ½ tablespoon Espelette pepper or red-pepper flakes, 2 thinly sliced scallions, and some flaky sea salt if you have any.

title: Irene's New Meatloaf
description: A classic comfort food meatloaf made with ground beef, oats, and savory seasonings. This hearty dish features a tangy ketchup glaze and bakes to a crispy golden top.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dried basil (or a bunch of fresh basil, chopped)

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

In a large bowl, combine 2 lbs 80% ground beef, 1 cup oatmeal, 1/2 cup milk, 2 eggs, 1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 cup ketchup, 1/2 cup diced onion, 1 tbsp garlic powder, and 1 tbsp dried basil (or chopped fresh basil).
Mix all ingredients together thoroughly until well combined.
Form the mixture into a loaf shape on a baking sheet.
Spread additional ketchup evenly over the top of the meatloaf.
Bake at 375°F for about 45 minutes, or until the top is crispy and the internal temperature reaches 160°F.
Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Joe's Meatloaf
description: A flavorful twist on classic meatloaf featuring a blend of ground beef and chorizo with sweet corn and bell peppers. Topped with a tangy BBQ glaze and baked until crispy on the outside.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, combine BBQ sauce, tomato sauce, and a splash of Worcestershire sauce to make the glaze. Set aside.

In a large bowl, combine 1.5 lb ground beef, 0.5 lb chorizo, 1 cup frozen sweet yellow corn, 1 chopped onion, 3/4 cup Panko breadcrumbs, 1 finely chopped orange bell pepper, 2 eggs, 1/4 cup heavy whipping cream, 1 tablespoon fresh basil, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon mild chili powder, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder.
Mix all ingredients together thoroughly until well combined.
Form the mixture into a loaf shape on a baking sheet.
Spread the prepared glaze evenly over the top of the meatloaf.
Bake at 375°F for about 45 minutes, until the top is crispy and internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

title: Kerala-Style Chicken and Vegetable Korma
description: A fragrant and creamy South Indian curry featuring tender chicken and vegetables in a spiced coconut-based sauce. This adaptation adds protein to the traditional Kerala vegetable korma while maintaining its authentic flavors.

ingredients.ingredient_name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
curry powder or korma spice blend
mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, green beans, bell peppers)

instructions.instruction_text: If marinating, combine 1 lb chicken pieces with 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp salt, and 1 tsp garam masala in a bowl. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp oil or ghee in a separate pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces and sauté until browned on the outside and mostly cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat 2 tbsp oil or ghee over medium heat. Add 1 large sliced onion, 4 minced garlic cloves, and 1 inch minced ginger. Cook until onions are softened and fragrant, about 5-7 minutes.
Add 2 tsp curry powder or korma spice blend to the pot and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the partially cooked chicken to the pot and stir to coat with the spice mixture. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add 2 cups mixed vegetables and 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk to the pot. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until chicken is fully cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt as needed. Sprinkle with additional garam masala and 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro before serving.
Serve hot with rice, roti, or naan bread.

title: Best Meatloaf Ever
description: A hearty American-style meatloaf featuring ground beef mixed with vegetables and seasonings, seared in a skillet before baking, and topped with a savory tomato-based glaze. This recipe uses a unique method of searing the formed loaf before finishing in the oven for added flavor and texture.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ground beef (85/15 or 90/10 lean to fat ratio)

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

In a large bowl, mix together 2 pounds ground beef, 2 large eggs, 1 medium finely diced yellow onion, 1 medium finely diced green bell pepper, 1.5 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon coarse ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder. Mix just enough to evenly distribute ingredients throughout the ground beef.
Add 1/2 cup all-purpose flour and 1/3 cup evaporated milk to the beef mixture, being careful not to overmix.
Form the mixture into a loaf shape with your hands. Add enough cooking oil to cover the bottom of a large skillet or Dutch oven 1/8 to 1/4 inch deep. Heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Carefully add the formed loaf to the hot oil and sear on both sides until browned. Remove skillet from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together 15 ounces tomato sauce, 1 cup BBQ sauce, 1/2 cup beef broth, and a splash of Worcestershire sauce to make the glaze.
Pour the glaze over the seared meatloaf, leaving any renderings or oil in the bottom of the skillet.
Bake in preheated oven for 45-50 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Halfway through baking, spoon extra sauce from the skillet over the loaf.
Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before transferring to a platter or slicing to serve.

title: Marty's Jerk Chicken
description: A flavorful Caribbean-style jerk chicken with aromatic spices and herbs. This dish delivers authentic island flavors with a perfect balance of heat and sweetness.

instructions.instruction_text: In a food processor, combine 2 tbsp ground allspice berries, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp thyme leaves, 2 tsp ground cinnamon, 1 tsp nutmeg, 1 tsp black pepper, 2-4 minced scotch bonnet peppers, 4 chopped green onions, 4 minced garlic cloves, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, 2 tbsp lime juice, and 1 tbsp white vinegar. Blend until smooth to create jerk marinade.
Place 4 lbs chicken pieces in a large bowl or zip-top bag and pour the jerk marinade over the chicken. Massage marinade into chicken, ensuring all pieces are well coated.
Marinate chicken in refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight for maximum flavor penetration.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat, or preheat oven to 375°F if baking.

Remove chicken from marinade and grill for 25-30 minutes, turning occasionally, until internal temperature reaches 165°F and skin is charred and crispy. If baking, place on lined baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional lime wedges and chopped green onions if desired.

title: Marty's Lamb Rub
description: A flavorful spice rub for lamb chops featuring a blend of garlic, herbs, and spices with a touch of brown sugar. Best when made a few days in advance and applied to the meat the day before cooking.

instructions.instruction_text: Mix together 2 tablespoons garlic powder, 2 tablespoons onion powder, 2 tablespoons fresh chopped parsley, 2 tablespoons fresh chopped thyme, 1 tablespoon paprika, 1 tablespoon smoked paprika, salt and pepper to taste, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon cumin in a bowl.
For best flavor, prepare the rub mixture a few days before you plan to use it and store in an airtight container.
The day before cooking, sprinkle one side of the lamb chops with the spice mixture, then brush lightly with olive oil (don't slather).
Turn the lamb chops over and repeat the process on the other side with the remaining rub and olive oil.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Remove lamb from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking to bring to room temperature.
For grilling: Cook about 2 minutes per side for medium rare, slightly longer for medium.
For broiling: Broil until desired doneness, adjusting time based on thickness of chops.

title: Fettuccine With Asparagus
description: A fresh and simple Italian pasta dish featuring tender asparagus spears tossed with fettuccine in a light butter sauce. Finished with aromatic nutmeg, fresh herbs, and Parmesan cheese for an elegant weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh fettuccine or 3/4 pound dried fettuccine
finely chopped fresh basil or parsley
ground pepper and salt to taste

instructions.instruction_text: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
Cut off tough ends of 6 asparagus spears (about 1/2 pound). Cut each spear on the bias into 1-inch lengths. There should be about 1 1/2 cups. Rinse well and drain.
Add the asparagus pieces to the boiling water and cook about 2 minutes. Remove asparagus with a slotted spoon and set aside.

Drop 10 ounces fresh fettuccine (or 3/4 pound dried fettuccine) into the same pot of salted boiling water. Cook to desired degree of doneness (cooking time will range from about 2 to 2 1/2 minutes for fresh pasta to 9 minutes or more for dried). Reserve 2 tablespoons cooking water. Drain the pasta.

Heat 2 tablespoons butter in the pot in which the pasta was cooked. Add the cooked asparagus pieces and the drained fettuccine. Add salt, pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg. Add the reserved 2 tablespoons of cooking water and 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh basil or parsley. Toss to blend. Serve hot with 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese on the side.

title: Springtime Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A fresh take on classic carbonara featuring spring vegetables like English peas and asparagus. The creamy egg and Parmesan sauce coats the pasta while the crispy bacon and fresh basil add wonderful texture and flavor.
source_attribution: NYT Cooking by Tara Parker-Pope, adapted from 'Almost Meatless: Recipes That Are Better for Your Health and the Planet' by Joy Manning and Tara Mataraza Desmond

ingredients.ingredient_name: English peas, shelled (about 1 cup), or 1/2 cup frozen peas
freshly grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for garnish (2 ounces)
salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.instruction_text: Heat a sauté pan over medium heat and add 3 slices of bacon cut into 1/4-inch pieces, cooking for about 5 minutes, until crispy. Transfer the cooked bacon with a slotted spoon to a paper towel and set aside. Return the pan with the rendered fat to the stove top for future use.

Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Drop 1/2 pound of shelled English peas (about 1 cup) into the water and cook them for 5 minutes. Transfer them to a strainer with a slotted spoon or a spider basket. Add 1 pound of spaghetti to the boiling water and cook for 10 minutes, or until al dente.

While the pasta cooks, heat the bacon fat in the sauté pan over medium heat. Add the cooked peas and 4 ounces of asparagus sliced diagonally 1/8-inch thick (1 cup), and sauté for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in 10 fresh basil leaves sliced thin, and set aside.
Whisk together 5 eggs and 2 tablespoons whole milk. Have the egg mixture, vegetables and bacon ready to toss with very hot pasta.

Quickly drain the pasta and transfer immediately to a large serving bowl. Pour the egg mixture and 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese on top of the pasta, and toss vigorously to coat the strands and gently cook the eggs, forming a creamy sauce. Add the vegetables and bacon, and continue tossing to incorporate them. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Portion the spaghetti on plates and ladle any sauce left in the bowl over each serving. Grate additional cheese on top if you like.

title: Fettuccine With Asparagus
description: A light and elegant pasta dish featuring tender asparagus spears tossed with fresh fettuccine in butter and nutmeg. Created by renowned chef Pierre Franey, this simple yet sophisticated recipe showcases the natural flavors of spring asparagus.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh fettuccine or 3/4 pound dried fettuccine
finely chopped fresh basil or parsley

instructions.instruction_text: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
Cut off tough ends of 6 asparagus spears (about 1/2 pound). Cut each on the bias into 1-inch lengths. There should be about 1 1/2 cups. Rinse well and drain.
Add the asparagus to the boiling water and cook about 2 minutes. Remove asparagus with a slotted spoon and set aside.

Drop 10 ounces fresh fettuccine (or 3/4 pound dried) into the same salted boiling water. Let cook to desired degree of doneness (cooking time will range from about 2 to 2 1/2 minutes for fresh pasta to 9 minutes or more for dried). Reserve 2 tablespoons cooking water. Drain the pasta.

Heat 2 tablespoons butter in the pot in which the pasta was cooked. Add the asparagus pieces and the fettuccine. Add salt, pepper and 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg. Add the reserved 2 tablespoons of cooking water and 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil or parsley. Toss to blend. Serve hot with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese on the side.

title: Elaine's Fettuccine Alfredo
description: A rich and creamy classic Italian pasta dish featuring fresh fettuccine tossed in a luxurious butter, cream, and Parmigiano-Reggiano sauce. This restaurant-style alfredo comes together quickly for an elegant weeknight dinner.

instructions.instruction_text: Bring 6 quarts generously salted water to a boil in a large pot.
While the water heats, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 small finely chopped garlic clove and sauté until fragrant and sizzling, about 2 minutes.
Whisk 1½ cups heavy cream with 1 large egg yolk in a bowl until blended, then pour into the garlic butter. Reduce heat to medium-low and stir until hot but not boiling. Keep warm over low heat.
Meanwhile, cook 1 pound fresh fettuccine partially covered until al dente (the pasta will float when it's done). Drain in a colander, shaking out excess water, but reserve a little cooking water.
Pour hot pasta into the cream mixture and toss to coat while still over low heat. Add 1 cup freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and keep tossing gently until cream is mostly absorbed.
Season with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. If sauce is absorbed too much, toss with a little reserved pasta water. Serve immediately in warm bowls.

title: Mashed Potatoes for Eight Hardy Souls
description: Rich, creamy mashed potatoes loaded with butter, garlic, bacon, and Gruyere cheese. This indulgent side dish is perfect for feeding a crowd and features a beautiful broiled crust on top.

ingredients.ingredient_name: (4 tablespoons) real butter, plus extra for treating dutch oven

instructions.instruction_text: Get 1/2 cube (4 tablespoons) of real butter and set it aside to soften.
Peel and cube 4 large potatoes.
Place cubed potatoes in a pot of lightly salted water and bring to a boil over high heat.
While potatoes boil, mince 4 garlic cloves and sauté in butter. Cook 4 strips of bacon until crispy, chop fresh chives, and grate Gruyere cheese.
Turn the oven on low heat and pre-heat a dutch oven-style pot.
Once potatoes are soft and easily pierced with a fork, drain the water completely.
Add the softened butter, sautéed garlic, heavy whipping cream, and season with salt and pepper (and herbes de provence if desired). Add bacon grease if available.
Beat or mash potatoes to your preferred consistency, adding more butter or cream as needed until creamy and rich.
Remove the pre-heated dutch oven from the oven and treat with butter, then scoop the mashed potatoes into it.
Garnish the top with the cooked bacon bits, chopped chives, and grated Gruyere cheese.
Place under broiler until a nice brown crust forms on top before serving.

title: Mueller's Classic Lasagna
description: A traditional Italian-American lasagna featuring layers of tender noodles, rich meat sauce, and three cheeses. This hearty comfort food dish is perfect for feeding a crowd and makes excellent leftovers.

ingredients.ingredient_name: mozzarella cheese, shredded or thinly sliced

instructions.instruction_text: In a large, heavy pan, lightly brown 1 pound ground beef and 3/4 cup chopped onion in 2 tablespoons oil. Add 1 (15-ounce) can tomatoes (put through blender or cut with edge of spoon), 2 (6-ounce) cans tomato paste, 2 cups water, 1 tablespoon chopped parsley, 2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon oregano leaves; simmer uncovered, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook 8 ounces lasagna noodles as directed on package; drain.

In a 13x9-inch baking pan, spread about 1 cup of sauce. Then alternate layers of lasagna noodles, sauce, 1 pound ricotta cheese, 8 ounces mozzarella cheese, and 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese, ending with sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
Bake at 350°F for 40 to 50 minutes until lightly browned and bubbling. Allow to stand for 15 minutes; cut in squares to serve.

title: Recipe Not Found
description: No recipe content was provided in the input text.

title: Our Favorite French Onion Soup
description: A classic French onion soup featuring deeply caramelized Vidalia onions in rich beef broth, topped with garlic-rubbed baguette slices and melted Gruyère cheese. This comforting soup requires patience to properly caramelize the onions but delivers incredible depth of flavor.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Vidalia onions (about 4 medium), halved lengthwise, peeled, and thinly sliced
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
homemade beef broth or store-bought low-sodium beef broth

instructions.instruction_text: In a large Dutch oven or other large pot, melt 3 tablespoons butter with 1 tablespoon vegetable oil over medium heat. Add 3 pounds thinly sliced Vidalia onions and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon kosher salt, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and ½ teaspoon granulated sugar; continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are deep golden brown and caramelized, reducing heat slightly if onions seem to be browning too quickly, 35 to 45 minutes more.
Add 1½ cups dry white wine and raise heat to high. Cook until almost all liquid has evaporated, 8 to 10 minutes.

Tie 10 sprigs thyme and 2 bay leaves into a bundle with kitchen twine. Add 6 cups beef broth and herb bundle to pot with onions. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook, uncovered, until broth is thickened and flavorful, 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from heat and whisk in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Taste and adjust seasoning.

Heat the broiler. Cut two ½-inch baguette slices for every serving of soup. Place baguette slices on a rimmed baking sheet and toast in oven until crisp and dry but not browned, about 1 minute per side. Rub one side of each toast with the halved garlic clove and set aside.

Place ramekins or oven-safe bowls on a rimmed baking sheet, add ½ teaspoon of sherry to the bottom of each, and ladle soup on top. Top each serving of soup with two garlic-rubbed toasts. Divide 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese among the servings, covering the bread and some of the soup. Carefully transfer baking sheet to oven and broil until cheese is melted and bubbling, 4 to 8 minutes.

title: Pasta Primavera with Asparagus and Peas
description: A fresh and vibrant spring pasta dish featuring tender asparagus, snap peas, and English peas tossed with fettuccine in a light cream sauce with Parmigiano-Reggiano and fresh herbs.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ¼ pound sugar snap peas, stems trimmed
¼ cup thinly sliced spring onion, white part only (or use shallot)
½ teaspoon fine sea salt, more as needed
⅔ cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, at room temperature
½ cup crème fraîche or whole milk Greek yogurt, at room temperature

instructions.instruction_text: Bring a large pot of heavily salted water to a boil over medium-high heat.
While the water is coming to a boil, slice ¼ pound sugar snap peas and ½ pound asparagus stems into 1/4-inch-thick pieces; leave asparagus tips whole.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced snap peas, asparagus, ¾ cup English peas and ¼ cup spring onion. Cook until vegetables are barely tender (but not too soft or mushy), 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in 2 finely chopped garlic cloves and cook 1 minute more. Season with ½ teaspoon salt and pepper; set aside.

Drop 12 ounces pasta into boiling water and cook until al dente (1 to 3 minutes for fresh pasta, more for dried pasta). Drain well and transfer pasta to a large bowl. Immediately toss pasta with the cooked vegetables, ⅔ cup Parmigiano-Reggiano, ½ cup crème fraîche, 3 tablespoons chopped parsley, and 1 tablespoon chopped tarragon. Season generously with salt and pepper, if needed.

title: Pasta with Spicy Sun-Dried-Tomato Cream Sauce
description: A rich and flavorful pasta dish featuring sun-dried tomatoes, roasted red peppers, and fresh basil in a creamy sauce. The dried crushed red pepper adds a perfect kick of heat to balance the creamy richness.

ingredients.ingredient_name: jar roasted red peppers, drained, chopped

instructions.instruction_text: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Add 4 finely chopped large garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute.
Add 1 cup chopped drained sun-dried tomatoes, 1 cup whipping cream, 1 chopped 7.25-ounce jar of roasted red peppers, and 1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper. Simmer over medium heat for 2 minutes.
Stir in 1/2 cup of the chopped fresh basil and simmer 1 minute longer.
Cook 1 pound penne pasta in large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Drain, reserving 3/4 cup pasta cooking liquid.

Return pasta to pot. Add the sauce, 1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, and remaining 1/2 cup fresh basil. Toss to coat. Add enough reserved cooking liquid to pasta to moisten if dry. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Portabello Mushroom Stroganoff
description: A vegetarian twist on classic stroganoff featuring meaty portabello mushrooms in a rich, creamy sauce. This hearty dish delivers all the comfort and flavor of traditional stroganoff without the meat.

instructions.instruction_text: Cook 12 oz egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 lb sliced portabello mushrooms and cook until browned and tender, about 8-10 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat. Add 1 large diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add 3 minced garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Sprinkle 2 tbsp all-purpose flour over the onion mixture and stir constantly for 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in 2 cups vegetable broth, ensuring no lumps form. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in 1 tbsp Dijon mustard and 1 tsp paprika. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Return the cooked mushrooms to the skillet and simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup sour cream until well combined.
Serve over the cooked egg noodles and garnish with fresh parsley.

title: Roasted Squash Bisque
description: A creamy, velvety soup made from roasted winter squash, blended to perfection with aromatic herbs and spices. This warming bisque is perfect for cold weather and makes an elegant starter or light meal.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 425°F. Toss 3 lbs cubed butternut squash with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes until tender and lightly caramelized.
In a large pot, heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 large diced onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks. Cook for 8-10 minutes until softened.
Add 3 minced garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon ground sage, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the roasted squash and 4 cups vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until completely smooth. Alternatively, blend in batches in a regular blender.
Stir in 1 cup heavy cream and 2 tablespoons butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat through and serve hot.

title: Classic Masala Scrambled Eggs
description: A flavorful Indian-style scrambled eggs dish featuring aromatic spices, onions, tomatoes, and fresh herbs. This protein-rich breakfast combines traditional masala flavors with creamy scrambled eggs for a satisfying and spicy start to your day.

ingredients.ingredient_name: chilies, finely chopped (deseed for less heat)
ginger-garlic paste (or finely minced fresh ginger and garlic)

instructions.instruction_text: In a small bowl, whisk 4 large eggs with a pinch of salt and set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon ghee or oil in a non-stick skillet or pan over medium heat. Once hot, add 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds and let them sizzle for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 1 finely chopped medium onion and 1-2 finely chopped green chilies. Sauté for 3-4 minutes until the onions have softened and are translucent.
Stir in 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute until the raw smell disappears.

Add 1 finely chopped medium tomato and cook for 2-3 minutes until they start to soften. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder, and 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder. Cook the masala mixture for another 2-3 minutes, until the oil begins to separate from the mixture.

Pour the whisked eggs into the pan. Let them cook undisturbed for about 30 seconds until the edges begin to set. Then, gently start to scramble the eggs with a spatula, folding them into the masala mixture.

Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked to your desired consistency. Be careful not to overcook them, as they can become dry. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon garam masala and 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with toast, pav (Indian bread rolls), roti, or paratha.

title: South Indian Vegetable Curry
description: A fragrant and hearty South Indian curry featuring sweet potatoes, regular potatoes, carrots, and aromatic spices cooked in coconut and vegetable broth. This comforting vegetarian dish is perfect for a warming dinner with complex flavors from garam masala, makrut lime leaves, and fresh ginger.

ingredients.ingredient_name: red-skinned sweet potatoes (yams), peeled, cut into 1-inch cubes
russet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1-inch cubes
finely grated peeled fresh coconut (about 4 ounces)

instructions.instruction_text: Puree 1 large onion (cut into chunks), 3 large garlic cloves, 1 piece fresh ginger (2-inch-long), 3 tablespoons sunflower oil, 1 tablespoon garam masala, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, and 1/2 chopped serrano chile in food processor until paste forms. Cook mixture in large pot over medium heat until aromatic, stirring often, about 10 minutes.
Add 2 tablespoons tomato paste to the aromatic paste in the pot. Cook until mixture starts to darken and brown, stirring often, about 5 minutes longer.
Add 3 cups vegetable broth, 2 teaspoons golden brown sugar, 2 makrut lime leaves, and 2 green cardamom pods. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring often and scraping up browned bits.

Add 1 pound cubed sweet potatoes, 12 ounces cubed russet potatoes, 1 1/4 cups grated fresh coconut, 2 sliced carrots, 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper to mixture in pot. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium low.

Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes. Add 4 ounces baby spinach if desired and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Discard lime leaves and cardamom pods. Transfer curry to serving bowl and garnish with 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro before serving.

title: Pan-Roasted Stilton Chicken with Apples
description: Tender pan-seared chicken breasts topped with caramelized apple slices and melted Stilton cheese. This elegant dish combines savory and sweet flavors with the rich, tangy taste of blue cheese for a sophisticated weeknight dinner.
source_attribution: From Chicken and Egg: A Memoir of Suburban Homesteading with 125 Recipes by Janice Cole, published by Chronicle Books LLC. Originally featured on Epicurious.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Honeycrisp or Fuji apples, cored and sliced 1/4 inch thick (about 2 1/4 cups)

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Lightly oil a small, rimmed baking sheet with extra-virgin olive oil or coat with nonstick cooking spray. Season 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves with 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper, and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary.

Melt 1 tablespoon unsalted butter with 1 1/2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the seasoned chicken for 6 minutes or until browned on both sides, turning once. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Add 2 1/4 cups of apple slices (1/4 inch thick) to the skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes, or until slightly softened and lightly browned. Spoon the apples around the chicken, placing a couple of slices over each breast.

Bake for 6 minutes or until the chicken feels slightly firm when pressed. Scatter 1/3 cup crumbled Stilton cheese over the chicken and apples. Continue baking another 2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Serve the chicken with the apples.

title: Vegetable Korma Lite with Basmati Rice
description: A lighter version of the classic Indian korma featuring mixed vegetables in a fragrant, mildly spiced yogurt-based sauce served over fluffy basmati rice. This healthier take uses Greek yogurt and cashew butter for creaminess without heavy cream.

ingredients.ingredient_name: –2 tbsp ghee, coconut oil, or neutral oil
(~450 g) mixed fresh or frozen vegetables
–2 tbsp cashew butter OR 4–6 soaked cashews or almonds, blended
plain unsweetened Greek yogurt (nonfat or low-fat)

instructions.instruction_text: Cook the rice: Rinse 1 cup basmati rice until water runs clear. Cook according to package instructions or use a rice cooker.
Bloom spices: Heat 1–2 tbsp oil in a large skillet or kadhai over medium heat. Add 2 tsp mustard seeds and let them pop. Add 1 medium chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Add aromatics: Stir in 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp garlic paste, and 3 sliced green chiles. Add 2 tsp black pepper, 1½ tsp salt, ¾ tsp Kashmiri chili powder, ½ tsp turmeric, and 3 chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes soften and mixture is fragrant.
Cook vegetables: Add 1 lb mixed vegetables and stir to coat. Stir in 1–2 tbsp cashew butter or blended nuts. Add a splash of water if needed, cover, and simmer for 10–15 minutes.
Temper yogurt: Lower heat. Whisk 1 cup yogurt in a bowl. Add a few spoons of hot sauce to it and whisk to temper. Stir tempered yogurt into the korma. Warm through gently — do not boil.
Finish: Sprinkle with garam masala and fresh cilantro to taste. Adjust salt and spices as needed.
Serve: Spoon approximately 325g korma onto each plate. Add about 150g cooked basmati rice (about ½–¾ cup) alongside.

title: Vegetable Korma with Optional Chicken (Heavy Cream Version)
description: A rich and creamy Indian curry featuring tender vegetables in a spiced tomato-cashew sauce made with heavy cream. This versatile dish can be prepared as a vegetarian korma or enhanced with marinated chicken for a hearty protein-packed meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ¼ cup ghee, coconut oil, or neutral oil
½ tsp garam masala (for marinade, optional)

instructions.instruction_text: If using chicken: Marinate 1 lb boneless chicken thighs or breasts with ½ cup nonfat yogurt, 1-2 tbsp heavy cream (optional), 1 tsp garlic paste, 1 tsp ginger paste, ½ tsp turmeric, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp salt, and ½ tsp garam masala (optional) for at least 30 minutes or up to 8 hours.
If using chicken: Sear the marinated chicken in a pan over medium heat for 5-7 minutes until golden. Set aside.
Heat ¼ cup ghee, coconut oil, or neutral oil in a large pot and fry 2 tsp black mustard seeds until they pop.
Add 1 finely chopped onion, 1 tsp ginger paste, 1 tsp garlic paste, and 3 sliced Thai green chiles. Sauté until onions are translucent.

Stir in 2 tsp coarsely ground black pepper, 1½ tsp sea salt, ¾ tsp Kashmiri chili powder (optional), and ½ tsp turmeric. Add 3 chopped Roma tomatoes (optional) and 2 tbsp cashew butter. Simmer until well combined.
Add 1 lb frozen or fresh vegetables and 1 cup heavy cream. Cook for 8-10 minutes until vegetables are tender.
If using chicken: Add the seared chicken to the simmering korma sauce and cook for another 10-12 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked through.
Garnish with garam masala and cilantro. Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Traditional Southern Baking Powder Biscuits
description: Classic Southern-style baking powder biscuits that are light, fluffy, and buttery. These tender biscuits are perfect for breakfast or as a side dish, with variations for shortcakes and savory options.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 450°F. To help ensure flakiness, chill all ingredients 30 minutes prior to making biscuits. Lightly grease a 9-inch round baking pan.
In a large mixing bowl, sift together 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Using a pastry blender or fork, cut in 1/2 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add 3/4 cup milk and stir together to form a soft dough, but not sticky. Note: Only knead dough long enough to form the ball. Avoid over handling.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and pat or lightly roll until 1/2-inch thick.
Using a biscuit cutter, cut into 8, 2-1/2 inch round biscuits. Place biscuits closely together into prepared baking pan.
If desired, brush with 2-1/2 tablespoons melted butter just before baking.
Bake in preheated oven 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Mango and Roasted Corn Salsa
description: A fresh and vibrant salsa combining sweet roasted corn with tropical mango, fresh herbs, and zesty seasonings. Perfect as a dip or accompaniment to grilled meats and fish.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove kernels from 2 ears of fresh corn, toss with a small amount of oil, and spread on a foil-lined cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes until lightly roasted.

In a large bowl, combine the roasted corn with 2 diced peeled mangos, 1/4 cup lime juice, 2 tablespoons diced sweet onions, 2 tablespoons minced fresh mint, 2 tablespoons minced cilantro, 1 1/2 teaspoons grated fresh ginger, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Toss gently to combine all ingredients. Chill in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

title: Spinach Artichoke Dip
description: A rich and creamy hot dip featuring spinach and artichokes in a cheesy sauce base. This crowd-pleasing appetizer is perfect for parties and gatherings, served warm with chips or crackers.

ingredients.ingredient_name: can artichoke bottoms, drained and chopped

instructions.instruction_text: In a large sauce pan, warm 1/4 cup olive oil and 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat.
When butter has melted, add 3/4 cup diced onions and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes.
Stir in 1 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic and cook 2-3 minutes longer, stirring frequently and stopping before the onions turn brown.
Sprinkle in 1/2 cup flour and continue cooking, stirring continuously until mixture turns a golden blond, about 10-15 minutes.
Slowly pour in 1 1/2 cups chicken stock, whisking continuously until smooth.
When mixture begins to simmer, add 1 1/2 cups heavy cream and return to a simmer.
Remove from heat and add 3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese and 2 tablespoons crumbled chicken bouillon cubes, stirring until blended.
Add 3/4 cup sour cream, 12 ounces frozen chopped spinach, chopped artichoke bottoms, 1 cup jack cheese, 1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 3/4 teaspoon tabasco sauce.
Stir until cheese is melted and all ingredients are well combined. Serve warm with chips.

title: Fresh Tomato Bruschetta
description: A classic Italian appetizer featuring diced fresh tomatoes mixed with mozzarella, basil, and garlic served on toasted baguette slices. The tomatoes are drained well to prevent soggy bread, creating the perfect balance of flavors.

instructions.instruction_text: Cut 4 large tomatoes in half and scoop out all seeds. Let drain well, then dice finely and drain again.

In a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/3 cup chopped fresh basil, 3 minced garlic cloves, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 2 tablespoons oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Mix well.
Toast slices of 1 long baguette on both sides until golden.
While the bread is still hot, rub each slice with the 3 halved garlic cloves.
Top each toast slice with the tomato mixture and serve immediately.

title: Chinese Spring Rolls
description: Crispy homemade spring rolls filled with seasoned ground pork, Chinese cabbage, and vegetables, wrapped in thin spring roll wrappers and deep-fried until golden brown.

ingredients.ingredient_name: mixed vegetables (carrots, shiitake mushrooms, green onion, ginger), chopped

instructions.instruction_text: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add 1 lb ground pork to the pan and cook until browned, breaking it up as it cooks.
Add 1 small chopped Chinese cabbage and 2 cups mixed chopped vegetables (carrots, shiitake mushrooms, green onion, ginger) to the pan.
Season with 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 pinch salt, and 1 pinch black pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes. Let filling cool completely.
Place a spring roll wrapper on a clean surface. Add 2-3 tablespoons of filling in the center.
Fold the bottom corner over the filling, fold in the sides, then roll tightly. Seal the edge with a little water.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) in a deep pot or fryer.
Fry spring rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per batch.
Remove and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

title: Cowboy Caviar
description: A fresh and zesty bean salad with black beans, corn, tomatoes, and cilantro in a tangy red wine vinegar dressing. Perfect as a dip with chips or as a side dish for barbecues and gatherings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.instruction_text: Make the dressing by combining 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, 2 minced garlic cloves, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon cumin in a small bowl. Whisk until well combined.
In a large bowl, combine 1 can drained black beans, 1 can drained corn, 1 bunch chopped cilantro, 4 chopped green onions, and 2 cups diced fresh tomatoes.
Pour the prepared dressing over the bean and vegetable mixture. Toss well to coat all ingredients.
Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Can be prepared up to a day ahead of time.
Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

title: Spinach Filled Mushrooms
description: Elegant appetizer featuring large fresh mushrooms stuffed with a savory spinach mixture and topped with parmesan cheese. Perfect for entertaining or special occasions.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh spinach or 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen spinach

instructions.instruction_text: In a medium saucepan, cook 3 pounds fresh spinach in unsalted water until wilted. Drain spinach and squeeze out excess water. Puree spinach for 2 minutes and set aside.
Remove stems from 36 large mushrooms. Chop stems finely and set aside.
Melt 1 1/4 cups butter and add 3 crushed garlic cloves. Dip mushroom caps in melted butter, coating all sides, and place cavity side up on a cookie sheet.
Reheat remaining garlic butter and sauté 3 finely chopped onions and chopped mushroom stems for 5-6 minutes until very soft.
Add pureed spinach, 1/2 cup bread crumbs, 2 teaspoons salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, 1/4 teaspoon dry mustard, and 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg to the skillet. Mix well.
Fill mushroom caps with the spinach mixture and sprinkle with 5 tablespoons fresh grated parmesan cheese.
Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 15 minutes. Cool slightly and serve garnished with fresh parsley.

title: Josephina's Bread
description: A savory cheese bread appetizer made with French bread slices topped with a creamy mixture of green chilies, Monterey Jack cheese, butter, and mayonnaise, then broiled until golden.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat broiler.
In a medium bowl, mix 4 ounces diced California green chilies, 1/4 pound softened butter, 1 cup mayonnaise, and 1/2 pound grated Monterey Jack cheese until blended.
Slice 2 loaves of small diameter French bread into thin slices and spread with the cheese mixture, making sure to cover the bread completely.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet in preheated broiler and broil about 5-10 minutes until golden.
Serve on large serving platter and garnish with parsley sprigs.

title: Bourbon-Glazed Shrimp
description: Succulent shrimp wrapped in bacon and glazed with a flavorful bourbon sauce. This elegant appetizer combines smoky bacon, tender shrimp, and a rich bourbon glaze with a hint of heat.

ingredients.ingredient_name: and fresh ground pepper to taste
bacon, cut in half lengthwise then crosswise

instructions.instruction_text: In a large pan, heat 1 teaspoon oil. Add 1 minced garlic clove and stir until golden.
Remove from heat and add 2 tablespoons bourbon whiskey, 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce, and 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce. Light contents with a long match and let alcohol burn off.
Return to low heat and add 3 tablespoons butter cut into small pieces, one piece at a time, stirring to incorporate into sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Heat broiler to high and position racks 5-6 inches away from heat.
Meanwhile, lay each of the 24 shrimp on its side, place a piece of the cut bacon along its back, roll up loosely and secure with a toothpick.
Arrange wrapped shrimp in a single layer and brush liberally with bourbon sauce.
Broil 3-4 minutes, turn and brush with sauce, and cook another 2 minutes. Discard remaining sauce before serving.

title: Fried Potstickers with Ginger Dipping Sauce
description: Crispy fried potstickers served with a tangy ginger dipping sauce. The perfect combination of golden, crisp dumplings paired with a flavorful Asian-inspired sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: peanut oil, plus more for deep-frying

instructions.instruction_text: In a saucepan over medium heat, warm 1/4 cup peanut oil. Add 2 tablespoons grated fresh ginger, 1 minced small garlic clove and 1/4 minced Thai chili pepper; sauté, stirring, until tender and fragrant, 2-3 minutes.
In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth, 1/4 teaspoon cornstarch, 1/4 cup rice wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon fish sauce and 1 tablespoon dark brown sugar, and whisk to blend.
Add the broth mixture to saucepan, bring to a boil while whisking, and remove from heat. Let dipping sauce cool at room temperature, then refrigerate until ready to use.
