Fill a deep-fry pan with 3-4 inches peanut oil and heat oil to 350°F.
Fry 12 potstickers, 3-4 at a time, until golden and crisp, 3-5 minutes or according to package instructions.
Serve hot with ginger dipping sauce alongside.

title: Vietnamese Imperial Rolls with Mint Sauce
description: Crispy Vietnamese spring rolls filled with pork, shrimp, and vegetables, wrapped in rice paper and deep-fried until golden. Traditionally served wrapped in lettuce leaves with fresh mint and dipping sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: leaf lettuce, torn into 4-inch square pieces

instructions.instruction_text: Soak 2 oz bean thread noodles in warm water for 15 minutes, then drain and cut into 2-3 inch lengths.

In a bowl, combine 2 lbs ground pork, 1/2 lb minced shrimp, the cut noodles, 2 minced shallots, 2 cups diced shiitake mushrooms, 1 minced garlic clove, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp fish sauce. Blend mixture with a fork.
Fill a wide dish with room-temperature water. Dip a rice paper wrapper into water, drip-dry and lay flat with pointed side toward you.
Add 1 tablespoon of filling to center of wrapper. Roll pointed end snugly over filling, fold sides inward to overlap and continue rolling to seal. Repeat to make about 30 rolls.
In a deep fry pan over medium heat, warm 2-3 inches of peanut oil to 350°F.
Fry 2-3 rolls at a time until golden, about 3-5 minutes.
To serve: Place each imperial roll in a lettuce leaf with a mint leaf, wrap lettuce around snugly and dip in vinegar sauce.

title: Bacardi Limon Mint Mojito
description: A refreshing citrus mojito made with Bacardi Limon rum, fresh mint, and lime juice. This sparkling cocktail is perfect for warm weather and entertaining.

instructions.instruction_text: Using a pestle and mortar, gently crush 1 bunch of fresh mint with the juice of 1 lime and 1 teaspoon superfine sugar until fragrant.
Add 1 3/4 ounces Bacardi Limon rum and 1 dash of triple sec to the mixture.
Fill the glass with dry, crushed ice.
Top with sparkling water or 7-Up and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of mint and serve immediately.

title: Citrus Sauce for Artichokes
description: A bright and herbaceous citrus vinaigrette featuring fresh lemon and orange juices with mint and chives. Perfect for drizzling over warm artichokes as an elegant appetizer or side dish.

instructions.instruction_text: In a small bowl, blend 1 chopped shallot with 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice and 3 tablespoons freshly squeezed orange juice.
Add 1 tablespoon chopped mint leaves, 2 tablespoons chopped chives, salt and pepper to taste.
Slowly whisk in 5 tablespoons oil to emulsify the dressing into a silken consistency.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper as needed.
Serve immediately with warm artichokes.

title: Asparagus with Balsamic Butter Sauce
description: Fresh steamed asparagus topped with a rich, tangy balsamic butter sauce. A simple yet elegant side dish that brings out the natural flavors of spring asparagus.

instructions.instruction_text: Steam 2 pounds of asparagus until tender-crisp, about 6-8 minutes.
While asparagus is steaming, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add 1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar to the melted butter and cook down until slightly reduced, about 2-3 minutes.
Season the sauce with 3/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, or to taste.
Pour the balsamic butter sauce over the steamed asparagus and serve immediately.

title: Genoese Pesto
description: An authentic Italian pesto sauce from Genoa made with fresh basil, pine nuts, walnuts, and two types of cheese. This traditional recipe creates a vibrant green sauce perfect for pasta dishes.

instructions.instruction_text: Wash 2-3 small bunches of basil and dry thoroughly.
In a food processor or mortar, combine coarse salt, 2/3 cup pine nuts, and 1/3 cup chopped walnuts. Grind until coarsely ground.
Add 4 cloves garlic and continue grinding until well combined.
Add the dried basil leaves and blend together until the mixture forms a paste.
Add 2 1/2 ounces grated parmesan cheese, 1 ounce grated Pecorino cheese, and 2 tablespoons olive oil. Blend until the mixture is light green in color.
When ready to serve with pasta, add 1 tablespoon of boiling pasta water per person into the sauce and blend to make smooth.

title: Parmesan Balsamic Vinaigrette & Lemon-Garlic Vinaigrette
description: Two versatile homemade vinaigrettes - a rich parmesan balsamic dressing with fresh basil, and a bright lemon-garlic vinaigrette. Perfect for salads, marinades, or drizzling over vegetables.

instructions.instruction_text: For Parmesan Balsamic Vinaigrette: Mince 1 clove garlic and mash with 1/2 teaspoon salt to form a paste.
In a bowl, combine the garlic paste with 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 3 tablespoons fresh minced basil.
While whisking continuously, slowly add 1/3 cup olive oil until well blended. Stir in 1/4 cup finely grated parmesan cheese.
For Lemon-Garlic Vinaigrette: Using a mortar and pestle, grind 2 smashed and peeled garlic cloves, zest of 1 large lemon (about 2 teaspoons), and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt into a fine paste.
In a separate bowl, combine 1/3 cup fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon champagne vinegar, 1/4 cup water, and 1 teaspoon sugar.
Add the lemon juice mixture to the garlic paste, then slowly whisk in 1/2 cup canola oil or light oil. Add pepper to taste.

title: Salad Parmesan and Blue Cheese Vinegar Dressing
description: Two salad dressing recipes - a creamy parmesan dressing and a blue cheese vinegar dressing

instructions.instruction_text: For Parmesan dressing: In a blender, combine 4-6 pressed garlic cloves, 1 cup oil, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, 1 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard, and 4 tablespoons lemon juice.
Blend all Parmesan dressing ingredients until smooth and well combined. Chill in refrigerator before serving.

For blue cheese vinegar dressing: In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup red wine vinegar, 2 1/2 ounces blue cheese, 2 teaspoons salt, 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard, 3/4 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon salad supreme seasoning, 4 pressed garlic cloves, and 2 cups oil.
Mix blue cheese dressing ingredients well until thoroughly combined. Toss with salad just before serving.

title: Honey Mustard Dressing
description: A sweet and tangy dressing that's perfect for salad greens, fresh fruit, or sliced avocados. This versatile dressing combines the brightness of grapefruit juice with honey and Dijon mustard for a delicious homemade dressing.

instructions.instruction_text: In a small bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup grapefruit juice, 1/4 cup oil, 1/4 cup honey, 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard, and 1 minced garlic clove until well blended.
Stir in 2 tablespoons dried onions and 1 tablespoon poppy seeds until combined.
Cover and chill in refrigerator before serving.
Serve over salad greens, fruit, or sliced avocados.

title: Cabernet-Peppercorn Sauce
description: A rich and flavorful wine sauce with mushrooms and crushed peppercorns, excellent for serving over steaks. This restaurant-style sauce combines the depth of cabernet sauvignon with savory beef broth for an elegant finishing touch.

instructions.instruction_text: In a medium saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons butter then add 1 1/2 cups sliced mushrooms and sauté for 3 minutes.
Stir in 2 crushed garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons flour, mixing well.
Stir in 1 cup beef broth and 1/2 cup cabernet sauvignon and boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes.
Stir in 2 tablespoons steak sauce and 1 1/2 tablespoons crushed peppercorns.
To reduce thickness, add more wine as needed. Makes 1 1/2 cups of sauce.

title: Italian Tomato Sauce
description: A hearty Italian tomato sauce made with ground beef and sweet sausage, simmered with tomatoes and aromatic herbs. Perfect for serving over pasta or any dish that needs a rich, flavorful sauce.

instructions.instruction_text: Heat 1/2 cup oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add 2 chopped onions and 4 chopped garlic cloves and sauté until softened and fragrant.
Add 2 pounds ground beef and 4 Italian sweet sausages to the pot. Brown the meat thoroughly, breaking up the ground beef as it cooks. Drain excess fat.
Add 4 (28 oz) cans Italian tomatoes and 2 cans tomato paste to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens, about 20-30 minutes.
During the last 5 minutes of cooking, add 2 tablespoons sugar, 2 tablespoons oregano, 2 tablespoons basil, 4 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Stir well to combine.
Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup fresh Parmesan cheese. Serve over noodles or your desired dish.

title: Tomato and Basil Soup
description: A classic creamy tomato soup infused with fresh basil and enriched with heavy cream. This comforting soup can be served hot or chilled and makes for a perfect starter or light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: and fresh ground pepper to taste

instructions.instruction_text: In a large pot, sauté 1 medium onion in 1 tablespoon olive oil and cook until soft, about 7 minutes.
Add 2 large cans tomatoes, 6 sprigs minced fresh basil, 1 minced shallot, 4 cups chicken broth, salt and pepper to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then lower heat and reduce soup by about 1/4.
Puree the soup mixture until smooth using an immersion blender or food processor.
Heat the pureed soup and stir in 1 cup heavy cream.
Serve hot with fresh basil garnish, or serve cold if preferred.

title: Curried Chicken Salad
description: A creamy and flavorful chicken salad with tropical pineapple, crunchy nuts, and aromatic curry powder. Perfect for lunch or light dinner, served cold for refreshing meal.

instructions.instruction_text: In a large bowl, mix 1 cup mayonnaise, 1 cup sour cream, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon curry powder until well blended.
Add 3 cups diced cooked chicken, 4 cups pineapple chunks, 4 cups chopped almonds or cashews, and 4 cups seedless grapes to the dressing.
Toss all ingredients together until evenly coated with dressing.
Serve cold.

title: Oriental Chicken Salad
description: A crunchy Asian-inspired salad featuring crispy ramen noodles, fresh vegetables, and a tangy soy-vinegar dressing. Perfect as a light meal or side dish with optional mandarin oranges for sweetness.

instructions.instruction_text: Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 packages of ramen noodles (broken into small pieces), 1 cup sliced almonds, and 2 tablespoons sesame seeds. Stir until lightly browned, then remove from heat and cool completely.

Make the dressing by combining 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup rice vinegar, 3/4 cup peanut oil, and 2 tablespoons soy sauce in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute, then remove from heat and cool completely.
In a large bowl, mix the chopped Napa cabbage, lettuce, green onions, and celery. Add the cooled noodle mixture and pour the cooled dressing over everything. Toss lightly to combine.
Add mandarin oranges if desired just before serving.

title: Berry Mandarin Tossed Salad
description: A refreshing mixed green salad featuring sweet strawberries, mandarin oranges, and crunchy toasted almonds, tossed in a honey-sweetened vinaigrette and topped with crispy bacon.

instructions.instruction_text: In a microwave-safe bowl, combine 1/3 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons cider vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 1/4 teaspoons lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, 1/2 teaspoon ground mustard, 1/2 teaspoon minced dried onion, 1/2 teaspoon celery seeds, and 1 dash salt. Microwave for 2 minutes.
Stir the microwaved mixture until sugar completely dissolves. Whisk in 1/3 cup oil until well combined. Cover and refrigerate the dressing.

In a large salad bowl, combine 8 cups torn lettuce leaves, 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries, 1 can drained mandarin oranges, 1 medium sliced red onion, 1/3 cup toasted almonds, and 4 strips cooked and crumbled bacon.
Just before serving, toss the salad mixture with the prepared dressing and serve immediately.

title: Carrot Salad
description: A refreshing and flavorful carrot salad with raisins, green onions, and a tangy vinegar-oil dressing. This Martha Stewart recipe features a hint of nutmeg for added warmth and complexity.

instructions.instruction_text: Soak 1/2 cup raisins in 1/4 cup cider vinegar for 30 minutes. Drain and reserve the vinegar.
In a large bowl, mix the soaked raisins with 2 pounds peeled grated carrots and 2-3 chopped green onions.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 3/4 cup olive oil with the reserved vinegar, salt and pepper to taste, and a dash of nutmeg.
Toss the carrot mixture with the oil and vinegar dressing until well combined.

title: Taco Soup
description: A hearty and flavorful Mexican-inspired soup with ground beef, beans, corn, and tomatoes. This easy one-pot meal is perfect for busy weeknights and can be topped with cheese and tortilla chips for extra crunch.

ingredients.ingredient_name: (15 oz) can Mexican chili beans, undrained

instructions.instruction_text: In a large pot, cook 1 lb ground chuck and 1 large chopped onion over medium-high heat until beef is browned and onion is softened. Drain excess fat.

Add 1 can Mexican chili beans (undrained), 1 can corn (undrained), 1 can tomato sauce, 1 can diced tomatoes (undrained), 1 can chopped chilies, 1 envelope Ranch dressing mix, 1 envelope taco seasoning, and 1 1/2 cups water to the pot.
Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Spoon soup into bowls and top with shredded cheese and tortilla chips as desired.

title: Chicken Gorgonzola Salad
description: A fresh and flavorful salad featuring tender shredded chicken breast combined with creamy gorgonzola cheese, crisp celery, and crunchy walnuts. This protein-rich salad makes for a satisfying lunch or light dinner option.

instructions.instruction_text: Cook and shred 4 chicken breasts, then set aside to cool.
Chop 4 stalks of celery into small pieces.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, chopped celery, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts, and 1/4 pound crumbled gorgonzola cheese.
Add 2 tablespoons white vinegar to the mixture and toss gently to combine.
Serve over mixed greens or lettuce as desired.

title: Wild Mushroom Soup
description: A rich and flavorful soup made with both wild and fresh mushrooms, enhanced with sherry and finished with cream. The wild mushrooms are soaked in sherry to intensify their earthy flavor.

instructions.instruction_text: Rinse 1 ounce dry wild mushrooms well, then soak them in 3/4 cup sherry for 1 hour.
Drain the mushrooms and rinse off any remaining sand. Pass the soaking liquid through a fine strainer and reserve. Leave mushrooms whole or chop coarsely.
Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a soup pot. Add 4 tablespoons flour and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add 2 chopped medium onions, 1 pound sliced fresh mushrooms, and the wild mushrooms to the pot.
Add 6 cups chicken stock and the reserved sherry. Bring the soup to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Lower the heat, cover partially, and simmer 1 hour or until the wild mushrooms are very tender.
Add 2 teaspoons sea salt and 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper. Taste and adjust seasonings.
Remove from heat and let stand 5-10 minutes before stirring in 1/2 cup heavy cream. Serve immediately.

title: White Bean Chicken Chili with Salsa Verde
description: A hearty and flavorful chicken chili made with salsa verde, white beans, and rotisserie chicken. This easy one-pot meal comes together quickly and can be topped with your favorite garnishes.

ingredients.ingredient_name: whole chicken, meat removed and shredded

instructions.instruction_text: Remove meat from 1 rotisserie chicken and shred into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pot, combine 1 jar salsa verde, 1 can drained corn, 32 ounces chicken broth, 2 teaspoons cumin, 2 cans drained white beans, 1 can rotel tomatoes, and the shredded chicken.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Heat the mixture over medium heat until warmed through, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with desired toppings such as diced onions, avocado, cheese, or sour cream.

title: Spiced Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and nutritious soup combining lentils, Italian sausage, vegetables, and warm spices. This filling soup is perfect for cold days and packed with protein and fiber from the lentils and beans.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh spinach or 2 boxes frozen spinach

instructions.instruction_text: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Brown 1/2 to 1 pound Italian sausages, breaking them up as they cook.
Add 1/2 cup diced onions, 1 cup diced carrots, 2 stalks diced celery, and 1/3 cup barley to the pot. Sauté for 5 minutes until vegetables begin to soften.
Add 3 minced garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon dried basil, 1 tablespoon dried oregano, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon salt, and 3/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in 3 quarts chicken stock and add 1 cup lentils. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer until lentils are tender, about 45-60 minutes.
Remove sausages from pot, shred or chop them, then return to pot along with 1 can garbanzo beans with juice and 12 ounces jar salsa.
Add 5 ounces fresh spinach (or 2 boxes thawed frozen spinach) and fresh parsley. Bring back to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes until spinach is wilted and heated through.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot.

title: Classic Popovers
description: Light and airy baked Yorkshire pudding-style rolls that puff up dramatically in the oven. These golden, hollow pastries are perfect served warm with butter or jam.

instructions.instruction_text: Put 1/8 teaspoon oil in each popover cup or muffin tin cup. Place the pan in the oven and preheat to 450°F.
While the oven heats, combine 2 eggs, 1 cup flour, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 cup milk, and 1 tablespoon melted butter in a blender. Blend on high speed until completely smooth.
Carefully remove the hot pan from the oven and fill each heated cup only 1/2 full with the batter.
Bake for 30 minutes without opening the oven door. Serve immediately while hot and puffed.

title: Herb Rolls
description: Buttery herb-crusted rolls made with refrigerator biscuits, flavored with parsley, dill, and Parmesan cheese. A quick and easy side dish that's perfect for dinner.

instructions.instruction_text: In a 7x10 inch glass baking dish, combine 1/2 cup butter, 1 1/2 teaspoons parsley flakes, 1/2 teaspoon dill, and 1/4 teaspoon dried minced onion. Place in microwave until butter is melted.
Add 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese to the melted butter mixture and stir until evenly distributed on the bottom of the pan.
Open 2 small cans of refrigerator biscuits and cut each biscuit in half. Place the biscuit halves in the baking dish.
Turn each biscuit piece over, making sure each is coated well with the herb butter mixture.
Bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes until golden brown.

title: Herb Rolls
description: Buttery herb rolls made with refrigerated biscuits, coated in a flavorful mixture of butter, herbs, and Parmesan cheese. These easy-to-make rolls are perfect as a side dish for any meal.

instructions.instruction_text: In a 7x10 inch glass baking dish, combine 1/2 cup butter, 1 1/2 teaspoons parsley flakes, 1/2 teaspoon dried dill, and 1/4 teaspoon dried minced onion.
Place the dish in microwave until butter is melted.
Add 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese to the melted butter mixture and stir until evenly distributed on the bottom of the pan.
Open 2 small cans of refrigerated biscuits and cut each biscuit in half.
Place the biscuit halves in the baking dish with the herb butter mixture.
Turn each biscuit piece over, making sure each is coated well with the herb butter mixture.
Bake at 425°F for 12-15 minutes until golden brown.

title: Janet's Napkin Rolls
description: Soft, buttery yeast rolls that can be prepared ahead and refrigerated for convenience. These tender rolls are perfect for dinner or special occasions.

instructions.instruction_text: Crumble 1 packet yeast and add 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/2 cup warm water. Set aside to activate.
In a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 cup butter with 1 cup milk. Heat on low heat until the milk scalds (small bubbles form around edge of pan). Let cool.
Beat 3 eggs and add to the cooled milk mixture.
Add half of the 4 cups flour to the milk mixture, then add the activated yeast mixture, then add the remaining flour. Stir with spoon after each addition.
Cover top of dough with melted butter and let rise to double in bulk in a warm place with no drafts, about 1 hour.
Punch down dough and cover with waxed paper and damp cloth, then refrigerate overnight or a couple of days.
Remove from refrigerator, punch down, and shape into rolls. Let rise until doubled.
Bake at 400°F for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.

title: Blueberry-Banana Bread
description: A moist and flavorful quick bread combining fresh blueberries and ripe mashed bananas, topped with a crunchy oat and banana chip streusel. Perfect for breakfast or an afternoon snack.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter a 5x9 inch loaf pan.
In a small bowl, gently toss 1 cup fresh blueberries with 1 tablespoon flour to coat.
In another bowl, combine 2 cups flour, 3/4 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon.
In a third bowl, combine 1 cup mashed bananas, 1/2 cup buttermilk, 6 tablespoons melted cooled butter, and 1 egg. Blend well.
Stir the flour mixture into the banana mixture until just combined.
Gently fold in the flour-coated blueberries.
Spread batter evenly in the prepared buttered loaf pan.

Make streusel topping by combining 1/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup oats, 1/4 cup chopped banana chips, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 2 tablespoons chunked butter, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Mix with fingers until fine crumbs form.
Sprinkle streusel topping evenly over the bread batter.
Bake for 60-70 minutes until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then invert and cool completely for 45 minutes before slicing.

title: Quick Caramel Coffee Cake
description: A quick and delicious coffee cake made with refrigerator biscuits and a rich caramel nut topping. Perfect for breakfast or brunch with minimal prep time.

instructions.instruction_text: Heat oven to 375°F. Grease the sides and bottom of a 12-cup fluted tube pan (bundt pan).
In a small saucepan, melt 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup firmly packed brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon water. Bring to a boil.
Add 2 cups toasted chopped nuts to the caramel mixture and stir to combine.
Put a couple tablespoons of the caramel-nut mixture in the bottom of the prepared pan.
Take 2 cans of refrigerator flaky biscuits and cut each biscuit into 4 pieces.
Place some biscuit pieces in the pan and drizzle half of the remaining caramel sauce over the biscuits.
Repeat with remaining biscuit pieces and caramel sauce to create layers.
Bake at 375°F for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.
Invert immediately onto waxed paper and remove from pan.

title: Kansas Coffee Cake
description: A classic bundt-style coffee cake with a cinnamon-nut swirl running through the tender vanilla cake. Perfect for breakfast or an afternoon treat with coffee.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a bundt pan well (do not flour).
In a large mixing bowl, blend together 1 package yellow cake mix, 1 small box instant vanilla pudding mix (dry), 3/4 cup oil, and 3/4 cup water. Mix well at medium speed.
Add 4 eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Turn mixer to high speed and beat for 8 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup chopped nuts, 1/4 cup sugar, and 2 teaspoons cinnamon.
Place 1/3 of the nut mixture in the bottom of the prepared bundt pan.
Fold the remaining nut mixture into the cake batter.
Pour batter into the bundt pan over the nut mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
Let stand for 8 minutes before inverting onto a cooling rack or serving plate.

title: Brown Butter Streusel Crumb Cakes
description: Tender individual crumb cakes topped with a buttery streusel and featuring rich brown butter for deep, nutty flavor. Perfect for breakfast or dessert with a delightfully crumbly texture.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease a 12-cup muffin tin or individual cake pans.
For the streusel, stir together 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a bowl.
Using two knives or your fingertips, cut in 8 tablespoons butter pieces until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Set aside.
In a small saucepan, melt 5 tablespoons butter over medium heat until golden and brown bits begin to form on the bottom. Pour into a bowl to cool.
In a small bowl, whisk together 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon baking soda, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, blend the cooled brown butter with 1/2 cup buttermilk and 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the remaining butter with an electric mixer until creamy. Add 1 cup granulated sugar and beat until light and fluffy, 3-5 minutes.
Beat in 2 eggs one at a time until well combined.
Reduce mixer speed to low and add the flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk mixture, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Mix just until combined.
Divide batter evenly among the prepared tins and top with streusel mixture.
Bake for 18-23 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack.

title: Cinnamon Roll Coffee Cake
description: A decadent coffee cake with a brown sugar pecan topping and cinnamon streusel layers. This indulgent cake combines the flavors of cinnamon rolls in an easy-to-make coffee cake format.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9-inch cake pan.
Stir together 3/4 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup heavy cream. Pour into prepared pan and sprinkle with 1 cup chopped toasted pecans.
Process 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/3 cup flour, 4 tablespoons sliced butter, 1 1/2 tablespoons cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon salt until small clumps form to make streusel.
In a bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup buttermilk, 1/4 cup vanilla yogurt and 2 eggs.
In another bowl, blend together 1 1/2 cups flour, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Cream 1/2 cup room temperature butter and 3/4 cup sugar until combined.
Alternately add dry ingredients and yogurt mixture to the creamed butter, starting and ending with dry ingredients. Beat after each addition just until incorporated.
Spread half the batter over the pecan layer in pan. Sprinkle with half of the streusel mixture.
Carefully spread remaining batter over streusel, then top with remaining streusel.
Bake 50-60 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.
Cool 5 minutes, run a knife around sides and invert onto serving plate.

title: Strawberry Cream Cheese Crepes
description: Delicate crepes filled with smooth cream cheese mixture and fresh sliced strawberries. A delightful breakfast or dessert that combines light, tender crepes with rich, sweet filling.

instructions.instruction_text: Beat 8 oz cream cheese until smooth.
Add 1 large egg and 1/3 cup sugar to the cream cheese and mix until well combined. Set aside.
For crepes, mix 1 cup sifted flour with 2 large eggs and 1 1/2 cups milk until smooth batter forms.
Stir 1 tablespoon melted butter into the crepe batter.
Heat a crepe pan or non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour batter into hot pan, swirling to coat bottom evenly. Cook until edges are lightly golden, flip and cook other side briefly.
Repeat to make 8 crepes total.
Fill each crepe with cream cheese mixture and fresh sliced strawberries. Fold or roll as desired.

title: Lemon Raspberry Muffins
description: Light and fluffy muffins bursting with fresh or frozen raspberries and bright lemon flavor. Perfect for breakfast or an afternoon snack.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease big muffin tins or line with paper liners.
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, 1 cup sugar, 3 teaspoons baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
In another bowl, whisk together 1 egg, 1 cup half and half cream, 1/2 cup oil, and 1 teaspoon lemon extract.
Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, just until moistened. Do not overmix.
Gently fold in 1 cup fresh or frozen raspberries (if using frozen, do not thaw them first).
Fill big muffin tins 2/3 full and bake for 22-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool for 5 minutes in the pan, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Muffins
description: Moist and flavorful pumpkin muffins studded with chocolate chips, toffee bits, and nuts. Perfect for fall baking with warm spices and rich pumpkin flavor.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease muffin tins.
In a large bowl, mix together 1 2/3 cups flour, 1 1/3 cups sugar, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg.
Stir 1/2 cup chocolate chips, 1/4 cup toffee bits, and 1/2 cup nuts into the dry ingredients.
In a separate bowl, mix together 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/3 cup melted butter, 2 eggs, 1 cup solid packed pumpkin, and 1/3 cup water.
Mix the wet ingredients vigorously into the dry ingredients until everything is blended.
Spoon batter into the greased muffin tins.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.
Remove from oven and let set for 5 minutes, then remove to a rack and cool.

title: Cranberry Nut Coffeecake
description: A sweet and tender coffeecake topped with cranberry sauce, nuts, and cinnamon. Perfect for breakfast or brunch, this easy cake features a simple biscuit mix base with an optional powdered sugar glaze.

instructions.instruction_text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease a 9x9 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, mix 2 cups biscuit mix, 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 egg, and 2/3 cup milk until combined. Spread mixture in the greased 9x9 pan.
In a small bowl, mix 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup chopped nuts, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Sprinkle this mixture over the cake batter.
Spoon 1/2 cup cranberry sauce over the top of the cake.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
For glaze (optional): While cake is still warm, blend 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, and 1 tablespoon water until smooth. Drizzle over warm cake.

title: Pizza Dough
description: A classic homemade pizza dough recipe using simple ingredients. This versatile dough creates a perfect base for any pizza with a tender, slightly chewy texture.

instructions.instruction_text: In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup warm water with 1 packet quick-rising yeast. Let stand for 5 minutes until foamy.
In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 cups flour and 1 teaspoon salt.
Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and add the yeast mixture and 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil.
Mix until a dough forms, then knead on a floured surface for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Punch down dough and roll out to desired thickness for pizza base.

title: Lemon Crepes with Strawberries, Jam and Mascarpone
description: Delicate lemon-scented crepes filled with creamy mascarpone cheese and strawberry jam, topped with fresh strawberries and orange zest. A perfect elegant dessert or special breakfast treat.

instructions.instruction_text: In a blender, blend 1 large egg, 1½ cups low-fat milk, 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest, ½ teaspoon vanilla extract, ⅔ cup all-purpose flour, ½ teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon canola oil until smooth. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight.
In a crepe pan over medium heat, melt 1 teaspoon butter. Lift pan from heat at slight angle and pour about ⅓ cup batter into center, tilting pan to spread batter to edges.
Return pan to heat and brown underside for 2 minutes. Flip crepe with spatula and brown other side for 1 minute more.
Transfer crepe to paper towel-lined plate and repeat process to make 8 crepes total, using 1 teaspoon butter for each crepe.
To assemble, lay a crepe flat and spread with 1 tablespoon mascarpone cheese. Add 1 tablespoon strawberry jam and fold into a triangle. Repeat with remaining crepes.
Garnish each crepe with 1 tablespoon mascarpone cheese, 1 tablespoon strawberry jam, sliced fresh strawberries, and finely shredded orange zest.

title: Lemon Crepes with Strawberries, Jam and Mascarpone
description: Delicate lemon-flavored crepes filled with whipped mascarpone cheese, strawberry jam, and fresh strawberries. A light and elegant dessert with bright citrus notes and creamy texture.

instructions.instruction_text: In a bowl, whisk together 2 large eggs, 1 cup milk, zest of 1/2 lemon, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp canola oil until smooth. Refrigerate batter for 2 hours.
Heat a crepe pan over medium heat and melt 1 tsp butter. Lift pan from heat at slight angle and pour about 1/4 cup batter into center, tilting pan to spread batter to edges.

Return pan to heat and cook until bottom is lightly browned, about 1-2 minutes. Using a spatula, flip crepe and brown other side for 1 minute more. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with remaining batter, adding butter as needed.
To assemble, lay a crepe flat and spread with 1 Tbsp whipped mascarpone cheese. Add 1 Tbsp strawberry jam and fold crepe as desired. Repeat with remaining crepes.
Garnish each crepe with 1 Tbsp additional mascarpone, 1 Tbsp strawberry jam, sliced fresh strawberries, and orange zest before serving.

title: Pizza Dough
description: Basic pizza dough recipe with parmesan cheese

instructions.instruction_text: Combine 3 cups flour, 1 pkg. quick-rising yeast, ½ t salt, and ½ sugar in a large bowl
Add 1½ warm water and 1½ T extra virgin olive oil to the dry ingredients
Mix until a dough forms
Knead the dough until smooth
Incorporate ¼ C parmesan cheese into the dough
Let dough rise until doubled in size
Roll out for pizza base

title: Chili and Cheese Egg Dish and Sausage Souffle
description: Two hearty casserole dishes - a chili and cheese egg bake and a make-ahead sausage souffle

instructions.instruction_text: For Chili and Cheese Egg Dish: Beat 10 eggs to light and lemon color
Add 1/2 cup flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to eggs and blend until smooth
Add 1 mini grated cottage cheese, 1/2 cup melted butter, and 2 cans green chiles
Pour into well greased 9X13 pan and bake at 350°F for 35 minutes
For Sausage Souffle: Grease 9X13 dish and put 8 slices cubed bread in bottom
Add a layer of 2 1/2 pounds sausage and 1 1/2 pound sharp cheddar cheese
Refrigerate overnight
Beat 4 eggs with 2 1/2 cups milk and 1 teaspoon dry mustard
Pour egg mixture over cheese
Add 1 can mushroom soup mixed with 1/2 cup milk

description: A baked version of chili rellenos with layers of green chile and jack cheese in a milk and flour mixture

Combine 3/4 cup milk with 1/3 cup flour and 1 teaspoon salt

Bake at 325°F for about 30 minutes

title: Asparagus Fettuccine and Baked Pasta with Basil and Parmesan Cheese
description: Two pasta recipes: fresh asparagus fettuccine with garlic and wine, and a baked angel hair pasta casserole with basil and parmesan

instructions.instruction_text: Cook 1 pound asparagus until tender but firm, then cut into 2 inch pieces
In large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and cook 2 cloves minced garlic for 1 minute
Add 1/4 cup dry white wine and cook 1 minute
Add 1 tablespoon butter and lemon zest, season with salt and pepper
Cook 1 pound fettuccine in salted water
Transfer pasta to serving bowl and add asparagus, top with cheese and chives
For baked pasta: Preheat oven to 325°F and butter 9x13 baking dish
Cook 6 ounce angel hair pasta al dente, drain and rinse in cold water
Melt 6 tablespoons butter and stir in 1 cup minced fresh basil
Mix with parmesan cheese and salt
Beat 4 eggs with 1 1/2 cups half and half, salt and pepper
Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing until well distributed
Place in prepared pan and sprinkle with remaining cheese
Bake covered 25-30 minutes
Let stand before serving, cut into squares

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: Classic beef stroganoff with tender beef strips, mushrooms, and onions in a creamy sour cream sauce served over noodles

instructions.instruction_text: In large skillet cook 1 lb beef strips in oil until tender and browned
Add 1 cup sliced onions and 1 can mushrooms, cooking until onion is tender
Add 1 can beef broth and cover and simmer for 10 minutes
Blend flour in tablespoons sour cream and add to skillet
Add 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder
Cook until slightly thickened, stir in sour cream
Heat but do not boil
Serve over cooked and drained noodles

Bring to boil then turn heat to low
Cook for 25 minutes without lifting lid
